question.title: Java process ocassionally dies on Linux after few hrs execution: How do I root cause the reason?
question.body:
• A java process I launch on Linux, occasionally dies.
  • Its a large piece of Java code that we inherited (we did not write it).
  • We have access to source code.
  • I am able to monitor the process in Jconsole whilst it is running.
  • The process randomly and quite often (but not always) dies after few hrs of execution. It takes several days for complete execution.

How do I debug what's going on?

It is not possible to add print statements throughout the code; or keep watching Jconsole for hours.

  • Can we run the process so that when it exits, we get a heap dump to analyze?
  • When the process exits, what can we do to capture as much useful info as possible to help with root causing the issue?
  • Which other tools are available to help us with this type of investigation?
